definition: (theater) understudy
to substitute for/to take the place of/to replace/for/on behalf of/to stand in for
angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]
role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale
surname Jue
erhua variant of 替角[ti4 jue2]

sentences.english: He is understudying the famous film star.
sentences.chinese: 他在爲那位著名影星充當替角。

sentences.english: The star actor was ill, so his understudy had to alternate for him.
sentences.chinese: 這位明星演員病了，因而他的替角必須代他演出。

definition: actor or actress/performer/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2]
substitute actor (esp. in fights of theatrical stunts)/stuntman
to play a small role
Brittany Murphy (1977-2009), American actress
pinyin: Bu4 lai2 te4 ni1 · Mo4 fei1

definition: in the movie
cheerleader
scene (in a movie etc)/one's part in a movie or play/(archaic) actor's payment
villain (of a drama etc)
costume of minor characters in opera, featuring dragon designs/walk-on
an extra (in a movie)
to act/to play a part
to play the role of/to act
role/character in a novel/persona/also pr. [jiao3 se4]
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act
Heath Ledger, Australian actor (1979-2008)
stand-in/substitute/body double/stuntman/scapegoat/fall guy/to stand in for sb else
